document_content.title: Referral to General Medicine for Evaluation of Recurrent Fatigue

sections.heading: Reason for Referral
sections.content: Ms. Sheffield is being referred for further evaluation of persistent and recurrent fatigue that has not resolved with initial interventions.

sections.heading: History of Present Illness
sections.content: The patient reports a 4-month history of increasing fatigue, described as a constant lack of energy that affects her ability to perform daily activities. She denies significant weight loss, fever, or night sweats. She has noted some mild headaches and occasional dizziness.

sections.heading: Relevant Medical History
sections.content: No significant past medical history. No known chronic illnesses. No previous hospitalizations or surgeries.

sections.heading: Medications
sections.content: Occasionally uses acetaminophen for headaches. No regular prescription medications.

sections.heading: Physical Examination
sections.content: Vital signs are within normal limits. Physical examination unremarkable. No lymphadenopathy, pallor, or organomegaly detected.

sections.heading: Investigations
sections.content: Recent basic bloodwork (CBC, metabolic panel, thyroid function) was within normal limits. Iron studies pending.

sections.heading: Summary and Request
sections.content: Given the persistence of symptoms and lack of clear etiology, I am referring Ms. Sheffield to General Medicine for further assessment and management. Thank you for your attention to this case.
